instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.S5_PWR_EN: What is S5_PWR_EN? S5_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on all S5 power rails when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power.
threads.message:
Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power

I have 12.58 stable 
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> acok - 3.40V
Magsafe - Ok
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.40V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5V present
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 0V missing
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> - 3.40V always

Customer told it was working and shutdown the laptop. Few hours will not turn on anymore. No liquid damage.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power.
threads.message: 3V on L7560? Check for short pulses on L7520. No auto ranging multimeter crap! Check all other rails for shorts.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power.
threads.message:
L7560 - 3.3V
L7520 - no pulse. I did it conecting and disconecting charger several times also but nothing on this coil.

No short on other coils.

<SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> - 0V

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power.
threads.message: I found missing 32KHZ and after replacing clock chip works. Problem solved.
